summary: The First French Empire was established by Napoleon Bonaparte in 1804, marking the end of the French First Republic. It lasted until 1814, with a brief return in 1815. Napoleon's empire expanded French influence across Europe through military victories. At its peak, it ruled over 44 million people and had a significant impact on European laws and society, introducing changes like legal equality and legalizing divorce. The empire ended with Napoleon's defeat at the Battle of Waterloo, leading to the Bourbon Restoration.
title: First French Empire
